Frequency response = F{h(t)}

Fourier transform of impulse response. Describes how system affects each frequency.

Y(ω) = X(ω)·H(ω)

Input spectrum multiplied by frequency response.

Gain at each frequency.
|H|>1: amplification
|H|<1: attenuation

Phase shift at each frequency.
Linear phase = constant delay.
Nonlinear = dispersion.

|H|≈1 for low ω
|H|→0 for high ω
Passes low frequencies, blocks high.

|H|→0 for low ω
|H|≈1 for high ω
Blocks DC and low frequencies.

Where |H| = 1/√2 ≈ 0.707
-3dB point. Power halved. Boundary of passband.

Range where |H| > 1/√2
For lowpass: BW = ωc
For bandpass: BW = ω₂ - ω₁

Frequencies in range [ω₁, ω₂]
Blocks below ω₁ and above ω₂. Radio tuning.

τg = -dφ/dω

Delay of signal envelope. Constant τg = no dispersion.
